title: Hamlet - Act 1, Scene 1 | Classroom Assignment
description: Comprehensive assignment for Act 1, Scene 1 covering key concepts and analysis.
subject: ELA

multiple_choice.q: In response to seeing the Ghost, Horatio says, "This bodes some strange eruption to our state." What does this line suggest about the theme of the supernatural in relation to political instability?
choices: The ghost is merely a personal omen for Hamlet.
The appearance of the ghost foreshadows a disruption in the kingdom.
Horatio believes the ghost is a trick played by soldiers.
The ghost symbolizes Denmark's military success.

multiple_choice.q: Why is Horatio initially skeptical about the ghost's appearance?
choices: He does not believe in ghosts or spirits.
He thinks the soldiers are trying to frighten him.
He believes the ghost is a foreign spy.
He is distracted by the threat of war with Norway.

multiple_choice.q: When Marcellus says, "Something is rotten in the state of Denmark," what tone is being conveyed?

short_answer.q: How does the ghost's silence contribute to the theme of uncertainty in this scene? Use evidence from the text.
What does the watchmen's insistence on bringing Horatio to witness the ghost reveal about their beliefs and fears?

title: Hamlet - Act 1, Scene 2 | Classroom Assignment
description: Comprehensive assignment for Act 1, Scene 2 covering key concepts and analysis.
subject: ELA

multiple_choice.q: In Claudius's speech, he says: "Though yet of Hamlet our dear brother's death The memory be green…" What is Claudius attempting to achieve with this opening?
choices: He is sincerely mourning the late king.
He is publicly acknowledging grief to justify his swift marriage to Gertrude.
He is warning Denmark of an impending war.
He is accusing Hamlet of disloyalty.

multiple_choice.q: Claudius speaks of young Fortinbras as "puffed with divine ambition." What does this line reveal about Claudius's view of Fortinbras?
choices: Claudius sees him as weak and harmless.
Claudius believes Fortinbras is overly confident and a threat.
Claudius wants to ally with Fortinbras.

multiple_choice.q: Hamlet responds to Gertrude: "Seems, madam? Nay, it is. I know not 'seems.'" What is Hamlet criticizing?
choices: The idea that grief can be performed as a display

short_answer.q: How does Hamlet's first soliloquy ("O that this too too solid flesh would melt…") reveal his internal conflict? Use a direct quote.
What contrast does Shakespeare establish between Claudius and Hamlet's perspectives on grief?

title: Hamlet - Act 1, Scene 3 | Classroom Assignment
description: Comprehensive assignment for Act 1, Scene 3 covering key concepts and analysis.
subject: ELA

multiple_choice.q: Laertes warns Ophelia that Hamlet's "will is not his own." What does he mean?
choices: Hamlet is too immature to love.
Hamlet must marry for political reasons, not personal desire.

multiple_choice.q: Polonius tells Ophelia to "tender yourself more dearly." What figurative technique is Shakespeare using?
choices: Metaphor comparing Ophelia to an object of value

multiple_choice.q: When Polonius says to Laertes, "To thine own self be true," what theme is being emphasized?
choices: Personal integrity is central to navigating the world successfully.

short_answer.q: How does Laertes's advice to Ophelia reflect gender expectations during the Elizabethan era?
In what way does Polonius's treatment of Ophelia reveal his character?

title: Hamlet - Act 1, Scene 4 | Classroom Assignment
description: Comprehensive assignment for Act 1, Scene 4 covering key concepts and analysis.
subject: ELA

multiple_choice.q: When Hamlet says, "Something is rotten in the state of Denmark," what literary device is being used?
What does the ghost's appearance at midnight symbolize?
How does Horatio's reaction to the ghost differ from Hamlet's?
choices: Horatio is more excited than Hamlet.
Horatio is more skeptical and rational.

short_answer.q: What does the ghost's silence suggest about its purpose?
How does this scene establish the theme of appearance vs. reality?

title: Hamlet - Act 1, Scene 5 | Classroom Assignment
description: Comprehensive assignment for Act 1, Scene 5 covering key concepts and analysis.
subject: ELA

multiple_choice.q: The ghost reveals that he was murdered by Claudius. What does this revelation do to the plot?
choices: It creates the central conflict and driving force of the play.
It has no impact on the story.

multiple_choice.q: When the ghost says, "The serpent that did sting thy father's life Now wears his crown," what literary device is used?
choices: Metaphor comparing Claudius to a serpent

multiple_choice.q: What does Hamlet's promise to "remember" the ghost suggest about his character?
choices: He will forget the ghost's words.
He will seek revenge for his father's murder.
He will ignore the ghost's request.
He will tell everyone about the ghost.

short_answer.q: How does the ghost's revelation change Hamlet's understanding of his situation?
What does Hamlet's vow to avenge his father reveal about his moral character?

title: Hamlet - Act 2, Scene 1 | Classroom Assignment
description: Comprehensive assignment for Act 2, Scene 1 covering key concepts and analysis.
subject: ELA

multiple_choice.q: Why does Polonius send Reynaldo to spy on Laertes?
choices: He wants to protect Laertes from danger.
He wants to gather information about Laertes's behavior.
He wants to send Laertes money.
He wants to bring Laertes home.

multiple_choice.q: What does Ophelia's report about Hamlet's behavior reveal?
choices: Hamlet appears to be losing his mind.
Hamlet is planning to leave Denmark.

multiple_choice.q: How does Polonius interpret Hamlet's strange behavior toward Ophelia?
choices: Hamlet is genuinely in love with Ophelia.
Hamlet is pretending to be mad.
Hamlet is mad because Ophelia rejected him.
Hamlet is plotting against the king.

short_answer.q: What does Polonius's spying on his children reveal about his character?
How does Ophelia's description of Hamlet's behavior contribute to the theme of madness?

title: Hamlet - Act 2, Scene 2 | Classroom Assignment
description: Comprehensive assignment for Act 2, Scene 2 covering key concepts and analysis.
subject: ELA

multiple_choice.q: What is the purpose of Rosencrantz and Guildenstern's visit to Hamlet?
choices: They want to help Hamlet with his studies.
They are sent by Claudius to spy on Hamlet.
They want to invite Hamlet to a party.
They are delivering a message from Fortinbras.

multiple_choice.q: How does Hamlet react when he realizes his friends are spying on him?
choices: He is angry and confronts them directly.
He pretends to be mad to confuse them.

multiple_choice.q: What does Hamlet's "What a piece of work is a man" speech reveal about his worldview?
choices: He has a positive view of humanity.
He is disillusioned with human nature.

short_answer.q: How does Hamlet's treatment of Rosencrantz and Guildenstern reflect his growing paranoia?
What does Hamlet's philosophical speech reveal about his state of mind?

title: Hamlet - Act 3, Scene 1 | Classroom Assignment
description: Comprehensive assignment for Act 3, Scene 1 covering key concepts and analysis.
subject: ELA

multiple_choice.q: In Hamlet's famous soliloquy, "To be or not to be," what is the central question he is contemplating?
choices: Whether to continue living or to die

multiple_choice.q: What does Hamlet's treatment of Ophelia in this scene reveal about his state of mind?
choices: He is genuinely in love with her
He is using her as part of his act to appear mad
He is completely indifferent to her

multiple_choice.q: When Hamlet says, "Get thee to a nunnery," what does this reveal about his feelings toward women?
choices: He wants Ophelia to become a nun
He is expressing his disillusionment with women and marriage
He is giving her good advice

short_answer.q: How does Hamlet's "To be or not to be" soliloquy reflect his internal conflict about taking action?
What does Hamlet's harsh treatment of Ophelia suggest about his psychological state?

title: Hamlet - Act 3, Scene 2 | Classroom Assignment
description: Comprehensive assignment for Act 3, Scene 2 covering key concepts and analysis.
subject: ELA

multiple_choice.q: What is the purpose of the play within the play (The Murder of Gonzago)?
choices: To test Claudius's guilt by observing his reaction

multiple_choice.q: How does Claudius react to the play?
choices: He becomes angry and leaves abruptly

multiple_choice.q: What does Hamlet's behavior during the play reveal about his strategy?
choices: He is trying to be entertaining
He is using the play as a psychological weapon
He is showing off his knowledge
He is trying to impress his mother

short_answer.q: How does the play within the play serve as a turning point in the drama?
What does Claudius's reaction to the play confirm for Hamlet?

title: Hamlet - Act 3, Scene 3 | Classroom Assignment
description: Comprehensive assignment for Act 3, Scene 3 covering key concepts and analysis.
subject: ELA

multiple_choice.q: Why does Hamlet not kill Claudius when he finds him praying?
choices: He is afraid of being caught
He believes killing Claudius while praying would send him to heaven
He has changed his mind about revenge
He wants to talk to Claudius first

multiple_choice.q: What does Claudius's soliloquy reveal about his character?
choices: He feels guilty about killing his brother
He is planning to kill Hamlet
He is happy with his situation

multiple_choice.q: How does this scene demonstrate Hamlet's moral complexity?
choices: He struggles between revenge and moral principles

short_answer.q: What does Hamlet's decision not to kill Claudius while praying reveal about his character?
How does Claudius's soliloquy humanize him as a character?

title: Hamlet - Act 3, Scene 4 | Classroom Assignment
description: Comprehensive assignment for Act 3, Scene 4 covering key concepts and analysis.
subject: ELA

multiple_choice.q: What happens when Hamlet confronts his mother in her closet?
choices: Hamlet kills Polonius, thinking he is Claudius
They plan to kill Claudius together

multiple_choice.q: How does Hamlet's treatment of his mother in this scene reflect his emotional state?
choices: He is filled with rage and disgust

multiple_choice.q: What does the appearance of the ghost in this scene suggest?
choices: The ghost is real and appears to remind Hamlet of his purpose
The ghost is trying to stop Hamlet
The ghost is angry with Hamlet

short_answer.q: How does Hamlet's accidental killing of Polonius change the course of the play?
What does Hamlet's confrontation with his mother reveal about their relationship?

title: Hamlet - Act 4, Scene 1 | Classroom Assignment
description: Comprehensive assignment for Act 4, Scene 1 covering key concepts and analysis.
subject: ELA

multiple_choice.q: How does Gertrude describe Hamlet's behavior to Claudius?
What does Claudius decide to do about Hamlet?
choices: Send him to a mental hospital
Send him to England with Rosencrantz and Guildenstern

multiple_choice.q: What does this scene reveal about Claudius's character?
choices: He is genuinely concerned for Hamlet

short_answer.q: How does Claudius's plan to send Hamlet to England reflect his political strategy?
What does Gertrude's loyalty to Hamlet reveal about her character?

title: Hamlet - Act 4, Scene 2 | Classroom Assignment
description: Comprehensive assignment for Act 4, Scene 2 covering key concepts and analysis.
subject: ELA

multiple_choice.q: How does Hamlet treat Rosencrantz and Guildenstern in this scene?
What does Hamlet's behavior toward his former friends reveal?
choices: He feels betrayed and is angry
He wants to be friends again

multiple_choice.q: What literary device does Hamlet use when he says, "A knavish speech sleeps in a foolish ear"?

short_answer.q: How does Hamlet's treatment of Rosencrantz and Guildenstern reflect his growing isolation?
What does this scene reveal about the theme of betrayal in the play?

title: Hamlet - Act 4, Scene 3 | Classroom Assignment
description: Comprehensive assignment for Act 4, Scene 3 covering key concepts and analysis.
subject: ELA

multiple_choice.q: What does Hamlet's conversation with Claudius reveal about his mental state?
choices: He is using wordplay and wit to mock Claudius

multiple_choice.q: How does Hamlet's wordplay in this scene serve his purpose?
choices: It allows him to express his anger indirectly

multiple_choice.q: What does Claudius's reaction to Hamlet's behavior reveal?
choices: He is frustrated and wants to get rid of Hamlet

short_answer.q: How does Hamlet's use of wordplay in this scene reflect his intelligence and wit?
What does this scene reveal about the power dynamic between Hamlet and Claudius?

title: Hamlet - Act 4, Scene 4 | Classroom Assignment
description: Comprehensive assignment for Act 4, Scene 4 covering key concepts and analysis.
subject: ELA

multiple_choice.q: What does Hamlet observe about Fortinbras's army?
choices: They are weak and poorly equipped
They are marching to fight for a worthless piece of land
They are planning to attack Denmark

multiple_choice.q: How does Fortinbras's action affect Hamlet?
choices: It makes him want to join the army
It makes him reflect on his own inaction

multiple_choice.q: What does Hamlet's soliloquy in this scene reveal about his character development?
choices: He has given up on revenge
He is inspired to take action
He is more confused than ever

short_answer.q: How does Fortinbras serve as a foil to Hamlet in this scene?
What does Hamlet's reflection on Fortinbras reveal about his internal conflict?

title: Hamlet - Act 4, Scene 5 | Classroom Assignment
description: Comprehensive assignment for Act 4, Scene 5 covering key concepts and analysis.
subject: ELA

multiple_choice.q: How does Ophelia's behavior in this scene reflect her mental state?
choices: She has gone mad with grief
She is pretending to be mad

multiple_choice.q: What do Ophelia's songs and flowers symbolize?
How does Laertes react to Ophelia's madness?
choices: He is angry and wants revenge

short_answer.q: How does Ophelia's madness reflect the theme of the destructive effects of revenge?
What does Ophelia's symbolic use of flowers reveal about her character?

title: Hamlet - Act 4, Scene 6 | Classroom Assignment
description: Comprehensive assignment for Act 4, Scene 6 covering key concepts and analysis.
subject: ELA

multiple_choice.q: What does Horatio's letter from Hamlet reveal?
choices: Hamlet has been captured by pirates

multiple_choice.q: How does Hamlet's encounter with the pirates affect the plot?
choices: It allows him to return to Denmark
It makes him give up on revenge

multiple_choice.q: What does this scene reveal about Hamlet's resourcefulness?

short_answer.q: How does Hamlet's letter to Horatio demonstrate his continued trust in his friend?
What does Hamlet's return to Denmark set up for the final act?

title: Hamlet - Act 4, Scene 7 | Classroom Assignment
description: Comprehensive assignment for Act 4, Scene 7 covering key concepts and analysis.
subject: ELA

multiple_choice.q: What does Claudius tell Laertes about Hamlet's return?
choices: Hamlet killed Polonius and must be punished

multiple_choice.q: What plan do Claudius and Laertes devise to kill Hamlet?
choices: Challenge him to a duel with a poisoned sword

multiple_choice.q: What does this scene reveal about Claudius's manipulative nature?
choices: He uses others to do his dirty work

short_answer.q: How does Claudius manipulate Laertes into becoming his ally against Hamlet?
What does the plan to poison Hamlet reveal about the characters' desperation?

title: Hamlet - Act 5, Scene 1 | Classroom Assignment
description: Comprehensive assignment for Act 5, Scene 1 covering key concepts and analysis.
subject: ELA

multiple_choice.q: What do the gravediggers' conversation reveal about death?
choices: Death is a natural part of life that can be discussed casually

multiple_choice.q: How does Hamlet react when he learns that Ophelia is dead?
choices: He is devastated and jumps into her grave

multiple_choice.q: What does Hamlet's confrontation with Laertes at Ophelia's grave reveal?
choices: They are bitter enemies competing for Ophelia's love
They are indifferent to each other

multiple_choice.q: What happens during the final duel between Hamlet and Laertes?
